Contents of text block. Supports markdow: I am a quantiative invasion entomologist specializing in biostatistics/data science, invasion biology, and teaching.  I am seeking to leverage my experience managing complex ecoloogical projects, analyzing data, and communicating results to a wide variety of collaborators to find a role as a data scientist.
I have worked in a variety of roles ranging from journalist to software engineer to data scientist. I like collaborative environments where I can learn from my peers.
Both learning and teaching are life-long skills that can be employed in any position. I am passionate about learning from and teaching others.
I regularly blog about data science and visualization on my blog [LiveFreeOrDichotomize.](https://livefreeordichotomize.com/)

These are a selection of first-authored publications. For a complete list of publications, presentations, and posters please visit my full CV at my [Google Scholar Profile.](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=A9i-yKcAAAAJ&hl=en&authuser=1)
